ContentEngine is born in 1996 as International Media Services (IMS), a Latin America-focused media services company operating in 18 countries throughout Mexico, Central and South America. In its inception, IMS was a clipping service, providing hard copy clips from print newspapers and magazines in Latin America to multinational corporations for research, intelligence and corporate communications purposes.In 1997, IMS incorporated Global Network Content Services (GNCS) to license news content from newspaper publishing groups strictly using digital delivery methods – the concept was to move from the print editions to digital delivery making news aggregation fast, reliable and cost efficient. The new process would also allow access to the digital versions of the publications. The concept was to have the digital editions of Latin America’s largest newspapers and magazines available in customer platforms before the print editions hit the streets.By 2006, news from Mexico, Brazil, Argentina, Colombia, Chile, Ecuador, Peru and Venezuela, among other countries, was being syndicated to Dow Jones, LexisNexis, ProQuest, Thomson Reuters and others. In 2008, Canada’s largest private equity group OMERS Private Equity and Marketwired acquired GNCS. In 2016, GNCS became a part of NASDAQ.In 2016, Hector Botero, the founder of GNCS launched ContentEngine to expand the library of titles available with a greater focus on legal, scientific and economic content. ContentEngine offers more than 300 titles (publications) updated daily.. ContentEngine licenses content exclusively to subscription-based professional research services including Artificial Intelligence applications. Distribution is strictly controlled.Our newswire, www.iCrowdNewswire.com with over 40,000 releases in its first two years continues to grow

Launched in 2015 by a senior team of corporate communications, news and financial news services executives, iCrowdNewswire is a marketing technology, software and newswire company deploying communications software and technology with key partners in specialized market segments including markets that are largely under served. iCrowdNewswire is focused on Regulated and Investment Crowdfunding, alternative finance, Fintech, civil society, regulatory disclosure, and global emerging markets. As part of its strategy, iCrowdNewswire licenses software, technology, support and management services, and operational know-how and experience through white-label solutions empowering partners to launch and grow their own communications services units. The team at iCrowdNewswire consists of senior executives from Dow Jones, Thomson Reuters, NASDAQ, Business Wire, PR Newswire and Marketwired among other leading news and information companies. The team is global in nature and based in major global hubs including: Berlin, Curitiba (Brazil), Hong Kong, Houston, Los Angeles, Miami, New York, Paris, Santiago, Sao Paulo and Singapore. You can see the iCrowdNewswire team at http://icrowdnewswire.com/about/#team.

Mr. Botero is the President of GFNN, the holding company for a network of companies specialized in providing financial information, technology and tools to the institutional investment industry. Our goal is to become the “go-to” mobile news, data and analytics solution for financial professionals. All of GFNN’s interactive and customizable tools and products are fully mobile application compliant. GFNN produces and publishes automated unbiased financial intelligence to increase performance and reduce risk for traders and investors in all categories of financial instruments including equities, debt, futures, commodities, mutual funds, ETFs and currencies. The company’s proprietary financial intelligence technology has a global reach in multiple languages.  In addition, a GFNN subsidiary recently entered into a distribution agreement with Markit Group, an international market data vendor dealing in financial information services which is co-owned by eight large banks including Bank of America, Merrill Lynch, Barclays, Citigroup, Credit Suisse, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan Chase and Morgan Stanley. Thomson Reuters recently joined the network.  Clients of GFNN or its subsidiaries include NASDAQ, Jefferies & Company, Knight Trading, OTC Bulletin Board.

Formerly known as the Emerging Markets Division, the new International Division continued its role within Marketwire developing international markets, expanding distribution networks, overseeing media and marketing research and providing support for the sales, marketing, product and client services groups. In addition to emerging markets worldwide, the new International Division includes a larger role in developed markets in Asia-Pacific, Africa, Europe, Latin America and the Middle East. As Vice President of the International Division, Hector Botero continued to report to President and CEO, Michael Nowlan.

Responsible for development and implementation of a growth strategy in the Asia-Pacific, Latin America, India, Russia and Middle East regions for Marketwire, the only fully integrated North America-based global newswire. Marketwire delivers its clients' news to the world's media and financial communities, fulfilling disclosure requirements in North America in compliance with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX). Having merged companies (Market Wire and CCNMatthews) in April 2006, and enjoying a combined history of 25 years of service, Marketwire is now majority-owned by OMERS Capital Partners, the private equity arm of one of Canada's largest pension funds. Marketwire distributes the majority of press releases issued by publicly traded companies in Canada and serves more than 11,000 clients worldwide through 17 offices on four continents. For more information, visit us at www.marketwire.com

summary: Hector Botero has spent the last 20 years in senior executive and entrepreneurial roles operating in developed and emerging markets worldwide. Mr. Botero led the International Division at Marketwired, a leading global news distribution and social media company serving public and private companies. At Marketwired, Hector Botero was the Managing Director of Marketwired China Holdings in Hong Kong; Chief Representative of the Marketwired Shanghai Representative Office in China; Director of Global Network Content Services (GNCS) in the United States; and a member of the board of Comunique-se Communicacion Corporativa in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Marketwired is majority owned by OMERS Private Equity which manages the private equity activities of OMERS, one of Canada's largest pension funds. The firm is located in Toronto, Canada and has $6.5 billion of investments under management. OMERS is one of Canada's largest pension funds with over $60 billion in net assets. From 1997 to 2008 Mr. Botero was President of Business Wire Latin America and Business Wire China. Business Wire is a wholly owned business unit of Berkshire Hathaway.Specialties: Mergers & Acquisitions, Business Development, Strategic Alliances, Funding, International Expansion Strategies, Business Process Outsourcing, Offshore Outsourcing, Asia Pacific, Latin America, Europe and India.
